div.p: S61/5846, unit 749, VPRS 1189/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
I have the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to sanction the following expenditure during the third quarter of this year.

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: Wages according to the rate of payments allowed last quarter

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: to which sum I would beg leave to be added the amount left available of the wages fund of last quarter, vize:

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: Employment of labour of mechanics by the piece or by the day for executing repairs or small work

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: Expense of publishing work on indigenous plants

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: Food and forage for animals, inclusive of such expenditure as is yet due of last quarter.

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: Travelling and incidental expenses, including such as are yet unpaid during last quarter

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

div.p: I have the honor to be,
your most obedient and humble servant

&c&c&c
MS file annotation: 'Some portion of the amount is already expended; for instance 60£ for male dromedary to Mr Landells. other claims are constantly coming in (for instancefor Lincolnshire,changesin circumstance, English fish &c) for which purposes this fund is supposed to be distinctly intended; & the only Government grant available for the purpose'.
The minute refers to the item 'Food and forage …',i.e.,for the animals housed at the Botanic Gardens in connection with the activities of the Acclimatisation Society of Victoria; 'Lincolnshire' is the vessel that transported the fish and birds listed in M to P. Ramel, 25 July 1861(in this edition as 61-07-25b), see report in Argus, 27 July 1861, p. 4, col. g. Lincolnshire was cleared out of Melbourne on 22 July ('Shipping intelligence', Argus, 23 July 1861).
